content.question: Past studies indicate that about 60 percent of the trees in a forested region are classified as softwood. A botanist studying the region suspects that the proportion might be greater than 0.60. The botanist obtained a random sample of trees from the region and conducted a test of <math alttext="H sub 0: p equals 0.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a: p is greater than 0.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of the test was 0.015. Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: If it is true that 60 percent of the trees in a forested region are classified as softwood, 0.015 is the probability of obtaining a population proportion greater than 0.6.

If it is true that 60 percent of the trees in a forested region are classified as softwood, 0.015 is the probability of obtaining a sample proportion as small as or smaller than the one obtained by the botanist.

If it is true that 60 percent of the trees in a forested region are classified as softwood, 0.015 is the probability of obtaining a sample proportion as large as or larger than the one obtained by the botanist.

If it is not true that 60 percent of the trees in a forested region are classified as softwood, 0.015 is the probability of obtaining a sample proportion as large as or larger than the one obtained by the botanist.
If it is not true that 60 percent of the trees in a forested region are classified as softwood, 0.015 is the probability of obtaining a population proportion greater than 0.6.

content.answer: If it is true that 60 percent of the trees in a forested region are classified as softwood, 0.015 is the probability of obtaining a sample proportion as large as or larger than the one obtained by the botanist.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
